DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Chemotherapy Or Radiation Therapy Prior 2 Year Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The verification of whether the donor received chemotherapy or radiation therapy for cancer or any other condition within past 2 years (prior to procedure start date/time) as provided by the primary history source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Chemotherapy Or Radiation Therapy Prior 2 Year Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Earlier in time or order._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Chemotherapy Or Radiation Therapy Prior Integer::2 Year Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Earlier in time or order.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the donor received chemot
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the donor received chemotherapy or radiation therapy for cancer or any other condition within the past 2 years?
